transportAdvice: Hakone is served by a network of mountain railways, ropeways, cable cars, and local buses that connect most major tourist attractions, making it very accessible without a car. Walking between sites is often impractical due to hilly terrain and distances, but public transit covers the key areas well and taxis are available for shorter or off-route trips.

weather.description: Cold and crisp winter days with occasional frost; clear skies can offer excellent views of Mount Fuji.
Still cold but gradually brightening; one of the best months for clear Fuji views and quiet onsen visits.
Early spring brings warming temperatures and the first cherry blossoms; some rainy days begin to appear.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming flowers and lush greenery; popular and can be crowded around holidays.
Warm and green with comfortable temperatures; a lovely time to explore outdoor areas before summer humidity sets in.
Rainy season brings frequent overcast skies and heavy rainfall; mountain views are often obscured by cloud and mist.
Hot and humid with lingering rain early in the month; mist and low cloud are common around the mountains.
Peak summer heat with high humidity; popular with domestic tourists escaping city heat, so expect crowds.
Typhoon season brings a risk of heavy rain and strong winds; travel plans may be disrupted by weather events.
Autumn foliage begins to appear and temperatures become very comfortable; one of the most scenic and popular months.
Peak autumn colors make this a stunning month to visit; cooler air and clearer skies improve Fuji visibility.
Cold and quiet with fewer tourists; excellent conditions for onsen relaxation and clear winter mountain views.
